course.subject: MARK
course.name: Customer Acquisition & Retention Leveraging Digital & Direct Science – Case Study Approach
course.description: This course will rely heavily on the “case study” method of teaching/learning, and will present multiple case studies of companies and products that have succeeded and failed in the digital and direct marketing space, with special emphasis on Direct To Consumer. In depth analysis as to why some failed and some succeeded will include modules on the scientific foundation principles of digital & direct marketing, testing, financial modelling, market research, creative development, tactical execution, media planning and selection, etc. In addition to the recommended reading, there will be extensive use of videos and other online materials.

reviews.author: Jessiiiiica
reviews.title: Best Course in UST
reviews.comment_content: The whole course is basically a powerpoint that's around 130 pages, with not a lot of content. He teaches about ways of digital marketing, and the classes have a lot of commercial watching, and analyzing what's good and bad.
reviews.comment_teaching: Eugene is an amazing professor. He actually tries to help you learn things that are useful in real life, and helps you get used to a lot of marketing terms. It's mostly lecture based, but he's pretty funny and talks pretty slow.
reviews.comment_grading: Attendance kind of matters. I did pretty well on all of the exams but skipped a few classes where he counted the attendance, and got an A instead of A+. Otherwise, it's pretty lenient because it's not graded on a bell curve.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is really little. There's no assignments or finals, just 3 'midterms' which are take home exams that take around 2 hours each to finish.

He gave 2 readings for the class which are really easy to read, but reading it makes a difference.

reviews.author: matthewwong49
reviews.comment_content:
Very rich material about advertising and direct marketing.

1. To gain a broad, but deep understanding  of the underlying principles of digital & direct marketing.

2.To thoroughly understand  and be capable of implementing a wide variety of digital & direct marketing programs.

3.To gain enough insight into each functional specialty of direct marketing so that you may choose an area of specialization if desired.

4.To lay a solid foundation of knowledge in the event you choose to pursue a career in digital/direct marketing.
reviews.comment_teaching: Extremely recommended to attend all of his class!! Very attractive and meaningful!
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading slightly better than the university standard.

Each exam is worth 30%
Class Participation is worth 8%
Mandatory UST research = 2%

Note: There is no “curve”, just like in the real world, and all three exams “count”, meaning we don’t throw out the lowest score. Numerical grades will be converted to letter grades according to standard distribution.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very little workload. Exams are take-home-exam and you can do the exam at home with other classmates. All exams will be “open book” so that you may source reference material, exactly as you may do in real business situations.

3 books are used as recommended reading but they also included in the exams.
1. 2,239 Tested Secrets for Direct Marketing Success
2. Successful Direct Marketing Methods, 8thEdition
3. The Medium is the Massage

reviews.author: ITSC
reviews.title: It's all about Media
reviews.comment_content:
側重好多係Media上面 其他就略略帶過
ModulesThe course is roughly divided into 8 modules as follows:

1.Digital/direct marketing essentials –various formulas, templates, etc. used in actual practice

2.Media –an in-depth survey of all media from all aspects

3.Operations management –fulfillment, call center, logistics, etc., particularly with a view toward understanding the impact on marketing planning;

4.Database marketing/CRM/Customer Experience/CustomerEngagement

5.SoLoMo –social, local, mobile marketing

6.Creative development & production

7.Digital & direct marketing math & economics –key metrics, leading indicators, various actual financial pro forma in use today back-end analysis, predictive modeling

8.Market research/Testing & measurement
